name: Cave Anole
description: Nearly translucent, it is camouflaged with a yellowish or ochre color and darker spots. Adult males have a band of blue spots behind the eye.
image_alt: Cave anole, photo: Tereza Mrhálková, Prague Zoo
proportions: Body length up to 20–27 cm, with two-thirds being the tail
reproduction: Females lay one (rarely two) eggs every 15–20 days; incubation lasts 60–70 days.
attractions: It hides in cracks, crevices, and small caves. With lamellae on its toes and sharp claws, it can agilely navigate vertical or overhanging limestone walls. Unlike many anoles, it lacks a typical throat dewlap. It is most active in the morning and late afternoon.
breeding: We have kept these anoles since 2006; seven offspring have hatched so far.
